title: Got S- and Champion token but no chest
body:
So, yesterday I got a S- mark on Xerath which awarded me with a Mastery Token. Yet it didn't give me a chest, I checked the champions page on my client and it still displays the grey chest icon on him.

Here is the link to the match: http://matchhistory.euw.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/EUW1/2698463968/42013767?tab=overview

replies.body:
From taking a look at your account, it looks like you were banned for 2 weeks by our Player Behavior systems a couple of months ago.  If you are punished by one of these systems, are you restricted from earning Hextech Loot and rewards until you've shown progress toward positive play.  This is different on a player-by-player and case-by-case basis, so there is no set time limit I can provide for when you'll be eligible again.  You can read more in-depth about it in our [Hextech Restrictions Article](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209939463).

Let me know if you have any other questions!
I am sure that this isn't the problem: I don't get the message about being restricted from extech anymore and I'm getting the Token reward.

I went ahead and double-checked your account and it appears that you are still ineligible to earn keys or chests.  You should still receive notification in the end-of-game stats screen confirming that keys or chests are not able to be earned. It is possible that there was an issue where that messaging did not appear :(

I hope this clarifies things a bit further!

Thanks for double checking. 

Well I am a bit confused now. Is the reforming period "composed" of 2 parts? Because early after my ban ended I got an S on Aurelion Sol (with whom I was already rank 5 and mastery 6/7 patch was out) and I didn't got the token.
Tokens are not given out for S- could it be that's what you got on aurelion?

Yes they are. Tokens are given out for S- and above for Mastery Rank 6 but only for S and above for Mastery Rank 7. He says he was L5 with Aurelion Sol when he earned the S, so even if it was an S- he would have gotten a token (where he eligible).
